                                                                              "message":  "- The post suggests that long-term planning, driven by the need to adapt to seasonal changes in northern climates, may have favored cognitive traits like foresight in some human populations, a hypothesis supported by the variability selection theory from the Smithsonian\u0027s Human Origins Program, which links brain enlargement to climate fluctuations over 800,000 years.\n- Archaeological evidence indicates South Saharan African populations faced less seasonal pressure, potentially leading to different survival strategies, though genetic studies (e.g., Tishkoff et al., 2009, in Science) show all modern humans share a common origin, challenging claims of inherent behavioral divergence.\n- Modern demographic shifts, with global fertility rates dropping to 2.25 children per woman (UN 2024), reflect cultural and economic factors more than historical adaptations, contradicting the post\u0027s implication of fixed regional outcomes.",
